label: Description
value: Pair of sleeves which would have been tied onto an 18th century dress. Left sleeve badly faded. Coral-colored ground with a curving vine with blue and white flowers. Finished at bottom with blue binding and small bow.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic yarns Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft (brocade) Label: silk brocaded with silk and metallic yarns

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. James O. Green
Design for a Pedestal and a Bowl, Intended for Execution in White and Rose Marbles for Marie Antoinette at St. Cloud

label: Description
value: The pedestal stands upon a base. It is supported at the corners by obliquely disposed griffins. A relief at its front shows two girls pouring water from a jar into an urn. Dolphin masks support festoons above. The bowl has a foot. One side of it is pointed, a mermaid is shown at the opposite one holding snakes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and grey and rose watercolor, black ink on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Abram S. Hewitt

label: Description
value: A frieze consisting of rinceaux motifs with three spirals connected by a bead festoon and a peahen eye. Reverse: Satyrs in landscape. Three Satyrs blow musical instruments, two Satyr children play tambourines. A Satyr carries a dead lamb to an altar, at left. A Satyress mixes a drink in the center. A terminus stands at right of her. Framing mouldings on top, at bottom are shown in the left part.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gray watercolor, Chinese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: An ovoidal medallion with cupid riding a dolphin is flanked by rinceaux. Verso: an ovoidal frieze is bordered by bands with laural garlands on top and bottom edge. The landscape consists of trees, plants, a house, a bridge, a gate, a poplar alley. Some men are shown, three of them near monumental Hermae. Bottom left: a part of a leaf border.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gray watercolor, Chiese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
Design for a Standing Frame, Probably for a Screen

label: Description
value: Moulded frame upon two feet shaped like entablatures of a pediment. Birds seated at the top corners support a garland hanging in festoons. The entire width is indicated as 28 po". An ovoid is sketched inside.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen and wash, Chinese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
Elevation of Pedestal and Bottom of a Crucifix

label: Description
value: Pedestal in architectural forms, with brackets as capitals of pilasters. The Holy Trinity is sketched in the panel. A capital upsidedown serves as a base of the cross, over the foot of which a sphere is shown. A snake is wound around the bottom part with his head before the capital.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, pen, ink, sepia wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
Design for Two Chairs with Alternative Suggestions

label: Description
value: In the center, a chair with a convex upholstered seat is shown from the front. The left leg of the right design serves simultaneously as the right foreleg of central design. The frame of the back is suggested. Upholstered entirely or with pierced lower corners; left, a right leg of different design; right, an armchair shown in profile. The seat and the arm show upholsterings, the frame marquetry. The scale is below.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, graphite on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
Design for the Cover of a Snuff Box

label: Description
value: Cupid, coming to Venus who is seated upon clouds, puts his left arm around her shoulders and points toward the earth as she does. Framed by a moulding with festoons hanging from bow knots and rosettes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen, brush and Chinese ink on sepia paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
Design for the Cover of a Snuff Box

label: Description
value: Cupid seated beside Hermes, gives him what probably is a letter. The setting is a park. Framed by a moulding with festoons hanging from bow knots and rosettes.

label: Physical description
value: Pen, brush and Chinese ink on sepia paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum
Leaf with Motifs for Decorations of Snuff Boxes

label: Description
value: A rocaille frame with a crane, a dolphin fountain, farming tools and a fountain at right. A trophy of musical instruments hangs from a bracket, top center. A bunch of flowers and fruits iwth a standing bird lies upon a balusttrade, bottom center. A bird flies toward it.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and Chinese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Rinceaux with circular medallions at the ends of the spirals. They contain landscapes, each with two figures. Festoons and tassels hang from the lower parts of the rinceaux. Framing mouldings are shown on top and bottom. Reverse: satyr in hilly landscape. Satyr blows musical instrument.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, brush and gray watercolor on Chinese black on paper

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. S. Hewitt; 1896: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Rinceaux with circular medallions at the ends of the spirals; two are shown. They contain landscapes, each with two figures. Festoons and tassels hang from the lower parts of the rinceaux. Reverse: satyrs in hilly landscape. Four Satyrs and a Satyr boy blow musical instruments, two Satyr girls dance. Framing mouldings on top and bottom are shown in B.

Fragment of a cartoon for cotton printing: Neptune or L'Empire des Mers

label: Description
value: Design of one of eight scenes. Center, lighthouse on rock foundation. Left, ship in distress. Upper right, small sailing vessel in quiet waters.
